title: Driver left covered in blood after car completely flipped over
text:
Liam Mackie, 20, escaped from the car with a cut to his head (Picture: Liverpool Echo)

A driver whose car flipped over as he tried to avoid two other vehicles has told of his ‘lucky escape’.

Liam Mackie, 20, had been dropping off his friend Matthew Coughlan, 20, when he claims two cars came hurtling towards him at around 1am.

He quickly tried to swerve away from the vehicles, causing his car to completely overturn onto a grassy bank by Coast Road, in Southport.

Fortunately he and Matthew were not seriously injured, but Liam escaped from the vehicle with a cut to his head.

The pair, who say they were had both wearing their seat-belts, called an ambulance and the police to come to their assistance.

The car completely overturned (Picture: Liverpool Echo)

Liam says he was following the speed limit, but hit a bollard when he tried to move out the path of the two oncoming cars.

He told the Liverpool Echo: ‘It was like we swerved into everything in our path. My head was pouring with blood and my blood was on the windscreen.’

Liam was forced to wear a neck brace for five hours after the accident, adding that he was ‘gutted’ about the damage to his car, which is only three weeks old.

His auntie, Tracey Brockett Mackie, called the men ‘so lucky’, adding: ‘They could have died.’

She added: ‘I’m so gutted for him, he’s such a good lad, he needs a car for work and the fact that two cars left him in that ditch is really quite shocking.

Liam’s family say he is lucky to be alive (Picture: Liverpool Echo)

‘They obviously seen he have to swerve to get out of their way, and they’ve just drove off leaving the scene not knowing if they were even alive.’

The family are now appealing for anyone who may have seen the crash to get in touch with information that could help an investigation.

Merseyside Police have been contacted for comment.

description: Liam Mackie was with Matthew Coughlan when his car completely overturned onto a grassy bank by Coast Road, in Southport.
